intro: Hieracium latebrosum, commonly known as the late broomweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks, preferring well-drained soils. Its yellow-orange flowers bloom in late summer, and the plant has hairy stems and leaves. Hieracium latebrosum is often found in disturbed habitats and can be an indicator of nutrient-rich environments.
